message.content: The generated code is trying to test the Flask routes directly which is causing the "Working outside of request context" error. A better approach would be to use the Flask test client to send requests to the application. This would involve creating a fixture for the Flask test client and using this to send requests in the tests. This way, the tests would be working within a request context.

function_call.name: write_files

message.content: The error "TypeError: Expected a string value" is being raised because the JWT encoding function is expecting a secret key to encode the token, but it's getting None. This is because the 'SECRET_KEY' configuration in the Flask app has not been set. A suggestion to fix this would be to set a secret key for the Flask app. This can be done by adding a line like `app.config['SECRET_KEY'] = 'your-secret-key'` in the Flask app setup.

function_call.name: write_files

message.content: The error "AttributeError: 'str' object has no attribute 'decode'" is being raised because the JWT encoding function is returning a string, not bytes, so there's no need to decode it. A suggestion to fix this would be to remove the decode method call on the token. So instead of `token.decode('UTF-8')`, it should just be `token`.
